Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries.  Report No: 97-364.
Placed on Private Calendar No: 31.
Called up by House by Unanimous Consent.
Passed House (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Received in the Senate, read twice, and referred to the Committee on Commerce.
Referred to Subcommittee on Merchant Marine.
Subcommittee on Merchant Marine. Hearings held.
Committee on Commerce. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.
Committee on Commerce. Reported to Senate by Senator Packwood without amendment. Without written report.
Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Regular Orders. Calendar No. 437.
Passed Senate without amendment by Voice Vote.
Cleared for White House.
Measure Signed in Senate.
Presented to President.
Signed by President.
Became Private Law No: 97-13.

official_title: A bill to revitalize the pleasure cruise industry by clarifying and waiving certain restrictions in the Merchant Marine Act, 1936, and the Merchant Marine Act, 1920, to permit the entry of the steamship vessel OCEANIC CONSTITUTION into the trade.

summary.text: Waives certain restrictions of the Merchant Marine Act, 1936, and the Merchant Marine Act, 1920, to permit the entry of a named steamship vessel into the coastwise trade.

titles.title: A bill to revitalize the pleasure cruise industry by clarifying and waiving certain restrictions in the Merchant Marine Act, 1936, and the Merchant Marine Act, 1920, to permit the entry of the steamship vessel OCEANIC CONSTITUTION into the trade.
